text: This monument, much like the man himself, is defiant against the foes of Nagash.
The Traitor King commanded his pyramid constructed, so that in life and beyond, all will know his might and dedication.
Deep within the halls of the Twisted Spire, the ruined pyramid tomb of the Dread King, lie the Catacombs of Terror with its throne room.

This ancient palace was the Dread Kingâ€™s original seat of power before he set out to conquer Nehekhara. After he was slain in the War of the Dead, the palace was abandoned as it was a ghastly and cursed place. But now the evil has returned.
A huge temple complex built during the first reign of the Dread King. After his resurrection, he set up his court here and regathered his strength.
The ancient colossi were revered and sometimes served in human armies. Their bones are brought back to Unlife to continue their service.
Noble animals in life, the elephants of the Southlands serve their masters even in death.
Restless souls are lured by Necromancers into arcane wells and tethered to others for ever more.
An unholy font of dark dreams and trapped spirits, used by Undead Lords to bolster their legions.
The foul beasts that roam the Old World have been slain and revived to reinforce the armies of darkness.
Only the best of the best may serve in the Dread King's Royal Guard.
The true masters of Necromancy have uncovered the secret of the creation of these Arcance machines.
The original inhabitants of this small settlement have long left this cursed place, however the dead still roam it.
Nowadays a town of the undead, this place was once an important settlement for trade.
An outpost of a forgotten civilication, used by the Dreadking's servants for their nefarious means.
Many centuries ago this city was filled with the sounds of bustling activity of the living. Now the undead carry out their tasks in eerie silence.
A mighty city-state of the past has now turned into the centre of the machinations of the undead.
The haunted citadel serves as arsenal and deterrent for attackers alike.
Under Nagash's influence the dead do not rest easily, no matter how well they have been laid to rest.
A ruined Stoa hinting to long lost glory.
Formerly a place of commerce for the living, now the dead gather their resources here.
A treasure house dedicated to Nagash. Woe to those who lay their hands on these cursed riches!
An upright stone slab dedicated to Nagash's many achievements.
A reminder of Nagash's superiority to his more sapient servants.
There is only one master of this world and all will serve Nagash in due time.
The Dread King went into the chamber alone to gaze upon the husk of Nagash...
